alert.note: Alert for Neshoba (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 24 at 12:03PM CDT until further notice by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Mississippi and east central Mississippi, including the following counties, in central Mississippi, Leake, Madison and Scott. In east central Mississippi, Kemper, Neshoba and Newton. * WHEN...Until 600 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1201 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain continuing to move across the area and flooding is ongoing. Between 4 and 9 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jackson, Canton, Philadelphia, Forest, Carthage, Morton, Newton, Prospect, Edinburg, Harperville, Nanih Waiya, Preston, Pearl River, Neshoba, Lawrence, Decatur, De Kalb, Liberty, Dowdville and Dixon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
